fr.sysgli.disbotapi.commands

Class Command

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sysgli.disbotapi.commands.Command

  • public final class Command
extends java.lang.Object
    Models every command : its name, the needed permission and the CommandExecutor.
    Author:
    Jérémy LAMBERT
    See Also:
    CommandExecutor

      Each command must have a name that will be used to identify it.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Command

        public Command(java.lang.String name)

        Each command must have a name that will be used to identify it. Specify the name without the command prefix.
        For example, if the command prefix is '&' and the command is meant to be used like this "&command", the returned value will be "command"

        Note : The command name is not case sensitive.

        Parameters:
        name -

    • Method Detail

      • setPermission

        public void setPermission(java.lang.String permission)
        Sets the permission needed to use the command.
        Set to null if the command is freely usable.
        Parameters:
        permission -

      • getPermission

        public java.lang.String getPermission()
        Returns the permission needed to use this command.
        Returns:
        String permission

      • setPermissionMessage

        public void setPermissionMessage(java.lang.String message)

        Sets the message to display if the user who used the command hasn't got the needed permission.

        Parameters:
        message -

      • getPermissionMessage

        public java.lang.String getPermissionMessage()
        Return the message to display if the user who used the command hasn't got the needed permission.
        Returns:
        String permissionMessage

      • setUsageMessage

        public void setUsageMessage(java.lang.String message)

        Sets the message to display if a command is not correctly used.

        A command with argument should always override the default usage message.

        Parameters:
        message -

      • getUsageMessage

        public java.lang.String getUsageMessage()
        Returns the message to display if a command is not correctly used.
        Returns:
        String usageMessage;

      • setExecutor

        public void setExecutor(CommandExecutor executor)
        Sets the behavior when the command is used.
        The command will do nothing if null.
        Parameters:
        executor -
        See Also:
        CommandExecutor

      • getExecutor

        public CommandExecutor getExecutor()
        Returns the instance of the CommandExecutor associated with this command
        Returns:
        CommandExecutor executor
        See Also:
        CommandExecutor

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()

        The name of the command without the command prefix.

        For example, if the command prefix is "&" and the command is meant to be used like this "&command", the returned value will be "command"

        Returns:
        the name of the command
